These settings allow you to control various options for the forums.
Choose the application you wish to administer.
When disabled only administrators and localhost requests are able to access the forums. A general 'forums' disabled message is displayed.
The name of your forums application. Used in the display of your site.
Enter a brief description to describe your forums.
Time zone that the forums database server is set to.
The number of threads to display on each web page.
The number of posts to display on each web page
Enable users to attach files when posting.
These are the file types that are allowed to be uploaded. Separate multiple types with a semi-colon (gif;jpg;png).
The maximum file size allowed to be uploaded. (Set to 0 to disable size checking).
Email address of the forums administrator.
Name of your company (required for COPPA).
Used in the 'contact us' section of the footer.
Enter the fax number where COPPA forms (if necessary) can be faxed to.
Enter the address where COPPA forms (if necessary) can be mailed to.
Displays the description for the forums.
Displays members who have birthdays today.
Displays the current (localized to the user) time on the home page.
Displays the 'Who Is Online' section on the home page.
Displays the 'Site Statistics' section on the home page.
Enable RSS Feeds for public forums
Forums will generate RSS feeds for all public forums.
Default number of threads displayed per/feed
Maximum number of threads displayed per/feed
How long a feed is cached for.
The member list link is removed from the navigation menu.
Allow users to use symbols for more complex member searches.
Number of site members to display per page when viewing the member list.
Number of top posters to display in the site statistics (max is 100 / min is 1).
Allow posts from the same user with duplicate contents from a previous post.
When duplicate posts are not allowed, duplicates are not allowed in this interval. Set to 0 to allow no duplicates ever.
Can users use emoticons within Posts.
How many posts are required before a thread becomes popular?
How many views are required before a thread becomes popular?
Days posts must be active within, i.e. received a new post.
Controls the pruning or removing of old posts from the forum.
Controls the automatic removal of users that are inactive as defined elsewhere.
Prevents one user from flooding the site with posts.
The time in seconds between posts used by the flood interval check.
Allow users to report a post to the administrators and moderators.
Allow anonymous users to use the reporting system (the selecting forum below must have Everyone-Post in the Role Permissions).
Select the forum that reports will be sent to. This forum must have the role 'Forum-Users' with post permissions to allow reporting.
Enable Tracking of Poster IP Address
Stores the IP address of the person who posted.
Displays the IP address of the poster.
Display Poster IP Address only to Administrators & Moderators
Displays the IP address of the poster only to administrators and moderators.
The format of all dates displayed. The user can override this setting in his/her profile.
The format of all times displayed. The user can override this setting in his/her profile.
Formatting of a Date/Time when the user joined the forums. Used when displaying posts.
When enabled displays the edits notes of a post at the bottom of the messages (before the user signature).
Edit Post Body Age Limit (in minutes)
When enabled enables a post title to be edited until the post has aged a specified number of minutes (set to 0 to allow infinite editing).
When enabled URLs to ForumGroups, Forums, and Posts are displayed as:

The roles cookie is used to store an encrypted semicolon delimited string with a list of roles the user belongs to. Storing this in a cookie alleviates the need to request this data from the data source on each request to the forums.
When enabled an HTTP cookie is used to store an encrypted string containing user roles.
Controls whether the forum tracks anonymous users IP when posting.
Name of the cookie used to store user roles.
Time in minutes at which the roles cookie expires after being issued.
The name of cookie used for anonymous users. Different than the one for members.
The time in minutes before the anonymous user's cookie expires.
Allows for creation of subdomain insensitive cookies (example ".yourdomain.com").
Controls whether anonymous users are allowed to post onto the forums.
Time in minutes to track the number of anonymous users accessing the site.
Enable or disable email support for the forums.
SMTP server used to send mail for your forums.
Does the SMTP server require a login.
The login name to use to access the SMTP server.
The password to use when logging into the SMTP server.
This option controls whether a post will support popup text when the user holds their mouse pointer over the topic link.
Allow automatic user registration of Windows Authenticated clients.
Strip domain name prefixes from Window's Authenticated UserNames.
Welcome to the ASP.NET Forums Administration Control Panel

The administration control panel is used to control and manage all aspects of the foums.
Please select an area or task from the left hand side of the page.
There is a new version of the ASP.NET Forums available!
You are running a custom build of the ASP.NET Forums!
Sorry, but we were unable to retrieve current ASP.NET Forums version information!
To retrieve version information please enable version retrieval in the configuration section. You will also be notified of any important bugs, etc. that you may need to patch.
The forums are {0} and have been running since {1} ({2} days, {3} hours, and {4} minutes).
There are currently {0} user(s) awaiting to be {1}.
There are currently {0} email(s) in the email queue.
Manage and create permissions on each forum.
Manage and create new forums and forum groups.
Controls the member names that are not allowed by using of pattern matching.
Valid patterns are: Name , *Name , Name* and *Name*.
When disabled, only administrators can login to the site.
When disabled, new users cannot register.
New users are moderated by default requiring a moderator to approve posts.
When enabled the board will auto-register users who authenticate via Windows authentication (Primarily for Intranet use of the forums).

Controls how users obtain access to the forums. Automatic allows users to create their own accounts. Email will email a password to the new user. Admin approval requires the administrator to approve new users.
Controls how users recover forgotten passwords.
Determines how passwords are stored in the database (MD5Hash is the most secure).
Use the COPPA registration system to comply with COPPA laws requiring children under the age of 13 to get parental consent before they can post
Allows users to change usernames. It's not recommended to enable this feature, since a username is a user's handle on the board. The administrator can change any username.
Allow user to edit a message that can appear at the bottom of all their posts.
When enabled a signatures will be added to posts.
When enabled (and specified by the user) the user's gender is displayed.
If various themes are available this option allows the user to select a theme for his/her display preferences.
Provides users with a URL that when clicked on will increment a users referrer credit for new users that join the forums.
Allows avatars to be images hosted at another website.
Maximum dimensions used when displaying avatars.
